svg.text: Showroom Content Verifier Workflow
INPUTS: What the Skill Asks For
• Content type (workshop module, demo module, or multiple files)
• File path or glob pattern (e.g., content/modules/ROOT/pages/*.adoc)
• Verification prompt location (repo-specific or global ~/.claude/prompts/)
PROCESS: What the Skill Does
1. Detects and selects verification prompts (repo vs global)
2. Reads all content files specified
3. Runs comprehensive validation checks:
- Red Hat style guide compliance (sentence case, product names)
- Workshop structure: Passes B (Structure) C (AsciiDoc) D (Style) E (Technical) F (Demo)
- Technical accuracy (valid commands, correct syntax)
- Accessibility (alt text, heading hierarchy)
- Content quality (completeness, formatting, references)
4. Runs passes B→C→D→E→(F for demos) in fixed order — all passes mandatory
5. Generates detailed issue sections FIRST, then summary table LAST
OUTPUTS: What It Produces
✓ Detailed issue sections with file locations, line numbers, before/after examples
✓ Implementation steps showing exactly how to fix each issue
✓ Validation summary table (Issue, Priority, Files affected)
✓ Strengths section highlighting what the content does well
✓ Total issue counts (Critical, High, Medium, Low)
Output stops immediately after strengths - no additional summaries
